page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY AROUND GRAFTON
page.content: Most villages have a manor house. In Temple Grafton it is Grafton Court. The lord of the manor had Temple Grafton school built in 1836 which became the Parish Hall that was later demolished. The present school was built in 1874, by a later Lord of the Manor. Binton village school closed in 1957 and is now the village hall. The Bell Inn (in Welford) is a 17th century building and is facing the small village green. One of the cottages (Boat Cottage in Boat Lane) was the origanal village inn. Hillborough used to be a large village until the plague came. Then people either died or went away and most of the cottages were left empty and fell into ruin. In aerial photographs you can still see the marks of the foundations of the cottages in the fields.
